item.title: Authorizing the printing of the Biographical Directory of the United States Congress, 1774-2005.

Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S4330; text as passed in Senate: CR S4330; text of measure as introduced: CR S4329-4330)

Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S4330; text as passed in Senate: CR S4330; text of measure as introduced: CR S4329-4330)

summary.text: Requires the printing of a revised edition of the Biographical Directory of the United States Congress for the period ending with the 108th Congress.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced in the Senate on March 24, 2003. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Implements the printing of a revised edition of the Biographical Directory of the United States Congress for the period ending with the 108th Congress.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
